intro: Erucastrum strigosum, commonly known as the hairy erucaceous, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along stream banks. Due to its habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
